Class BorrowRestrictionsTest

java.lang.Object
Tests.BorrowRestrictionsTest
public class BorrowRestrictionsTest extends Object
Unit tests for BorrowService focusing on borrowing restrictions. This test class validates the following scenarios: - Successful borrowing of a book - Borrowing with overdue books - Borrowing with unpaid fines - Borrowing with inactive user accounts - Checking if user can borrow under various conditions

  • Method Details

    • setUp

      public void setUp()
      Sets up the test environment before each test. Clears all books, loans, and users, then creates a test user and book.

    • tearDown

      public void tearDown()
      Cleans up the test environment after each test. Clears all loans, books, and users.

    • testBorrowBookSuccess

      public void testBorrowBookSuccess()
      Tests successful borrowing of a book. Checks that the book is marked unavailable and a loan is created with correct due date.

    • testBorrowWithOverdueBooks

      public void testBorrowWithOverdueBooks()
      Tests borrowing fails if the user has overdue books.

    • testBorrowWithUnpaidFines

      public void testBorrowWithUnpaidFines()
      Tests borrowing fails if the user has unpaid fines.

    • testBorrowWithInactiveUser

      public void testBorrowWithInactiveUser()
      Tests borrowing fails if the user account is inactive.

    • testHasOverdueBooks

      public void testHasOverdueBooks()
      Tests that hasOverdueBooks method correctly identifies overdue books.

    • testHasUnpaidFines

      public void testHasUnpaidFines()
      Tests that hasUnpaidFines method correctly identifies unpaid fines.

    • testCanUserBorrow

      public void testCanUserBorrow()
      Tests that canUserBorrow method returns true when user has no restrictions.

    • testCannotBorrowWithOverdue

      public void testCannotBorrowWithOverdue()
      Tests that canUserBorrow method returns false when user has overdue books.
